fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the user language or global language to e.g. Japanese;
 # In any issue, try to use any date picker field;
 # It will use "dd/MM/yy" in the Japanese interface.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should be able to use the same date format for all regions and languages.
h3. Actual Results

Japanese interface is not using the system default date format.
 * Issue affects all language except for English and German
fields.summary: The default date format is not taken into account when using any other language than English and German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62637].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When bulk editing based off of a filter, it will use the issues from the last filter that was run rather than the issues on the page that is being bulk edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a search
# Navigate to a different tab and run another search. 
# Navigate back to the first tab and click on Bulk Edit

h3. Expected Results

The issues listed on the Bulk Edit match the search from the first tab.

h3. Actual Results

The issues listed on the Bulk Edit are shown according to the search performed in the second tab.

h3. Impact

(!) Users can not perceive that the selection is showing different results and bulk edit the results for updates or deletion, causing *data loss*.
 
h3. Notes
Notice that the issues pulled into the bulk edit screen are the issues from the search in the other tab (although it's limited to the number of issues found on the first tab

h3.Workaround
Currently, there's no workaround for that.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit retrieving wrong issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62636].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using a touchscreen as an input device, touch/gesture responses are inconsistent and/or behave in an unexpected way when navigating Agile Boards.

(i) The issue has best reproducibility and visibility on a largely populated board with many issues and columns which cause the board to not fit in browser view, necessitating scrolling to see the whole board.

(off) Using a Windows 10 laptop with touchscreen capabilities, on Google Chrome 53.0.2785.116 m:

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe in blank space will scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe on an issue will pick the issue up and proceed with moving it around the board, which is *unexpected*. The effect of this is that largely populated boards can become difficult and unintuitive to scroll through.

(on) Using the same laptop on Firefox instead:

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe in blank space will scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe on an issue will still scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

h3. Suggested Solution

Normalize the behavior from within the application to match what is expected and happens in Firefox. It's desired that swipes scroll a page, and prolonged holds and then drags can perform a drag and drop instead. 

Consider revising JIRA's Supported Platforms documentations to be more explicit about using touchscreens as an input device, as well as Mobile versions of the standard supported browsers.

h3. Workaround 
Consider using a different browser, which may offer different behaviors when it comes to touchscreen behaviors.
fields.summary: Implement consistent touchscreen behavior on Agile Boards in Chrome

h3. Problem Definition
It would be interesting to have the ability to block certain parts of the project for users who have access to the project.
For example, block the access to the "Release" hub while allowing access to this resource for other users. Same for reports and stuff.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a specific permission for portions of the project.
fields.summary: Allow a JIRA admin to block certain parts of a project for users with project access.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62629].
  {panel}

I searched for the existence of this issue and will be surprised if it does not exist. However, the closest I could find were suggesting firing an event on a linked issue.

It would be great to have a new link type that would allow certain fields to be mirrored between the linked issues. Specifically, I would like to see Comments and Status be mirrored. When a comment is added to one it shows up in the other. When one of the issues is closed the other is closed. I realize the status could get messy if the linked issues have different workflows. As a suggested solution If when an issue is closed, if the workflows/statuses don't align then the user could be presented w/ a 'what do you want to do with the linked issue screen'.

Example use case:
# A user sends in a request to JIRA Service Desk for a product issue/enhancment
# The issue is cloned and moved to the development project in JIRA SW
# The developer works the issue to closure in JIRA SW
# Today somehow the Agent has to be manually notified to take action on the JSD issue. It is this manual action I am trying improve.
fields.summary: Add Link "Follow" capability

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While attempting users to the Watchers field in any issues,  users appear as duplicates (and the occurrence increases) in the suggested user list. 

h3. Environment
# The affected users could be users from External Directories, for example, _Microsoft Active Directory_ with mix case or uppercase in their username
# It also can be done with User Management's Edit User action on Internal Directory as long as username is mixed case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Log in to JIRA as the AD user with mixed case (problem is including Active Directory but not limited to it)
# Open another browser which does not share the same session as step 1, log in as an admin.
# Go to any existing issue and click to _Add Watchers_.
# Type the name of the AD user in the Watcher field but do not add it.
# Log out as the AD user and log in again.
# As an admin, refresh the issue page and attempt to add the AD user as a watcher again.

h3. Expected Result
There will be no duplicated users in the suggested user list.

h3. Actual Result
The username appear as duplicates on the user picker. With every logout and login, the usernames adds an additional duplicate entry on the user picker.

h3. Workaround
Restart JIRA.

(!) As soon as users start performing login cycles again, the number of occurrences in user pickers will increase again.
fields.summary: Duplicate entries for users in user picker fields
User Group Admin

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , when customer using non-English language for example Latvian. Were beginning of alphabet is "A, Ā, B, C, Č, D, E, Ē, F, G, Ģ....." and JIRA doesn't understand that letter 'Ā' needs to be after 'A' and put it in last place when sorting alphabetically.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62623].
  {panel}

We have a gravatar compliant server for our network of offices and JIRA, BitBucket etc are all set to use these avatars and it works well.

Users are however able to upload their own avatars directly to JIRA, which overwrites the gravatar image, and also shows up on the activity feed. We have clients and suppliers connecting to our JIRA instance, and as there is no security around the avatar feed, any avatar changes show for all users.

I propose the following solutions to mitigate this issue (and in this order of priority)
# Provide a way to disable local avatars and only pull from gravatar
# Customise the activity feed and hide avatar changes
fields.summary: Remove local avatar support if gravatar is enabled

h3. Problem Definition
Marketplace listing for https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-rest-java-client/server/overview is outdated.  Pre-fork we created a new release of JIRA Java REST Client.  However, this version was never released to the public.

Even though we don't officially support this plugin, we should still release it to MPAC as:
 * It adds value to customers
 * It's a small task
 * Customers are actually asking for it (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-43160)


h3. Suggested Solution
Release an updated version on Marketplace
fields.summary: Release latest version of jira-java-rest-client to MPAC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62621].
  {panel}

In Jira there are menus and they have highlight foreground and background color. For some reason highlight foreground color is white, which is not easy to see as the highlight background color is light gray. The highlight background color looks nice, but the highlight foreground color should then be black for clarity. I have noticed that in some other applications the highlight foreground color is black, too. Someone also said that the highlight foreground color could not be changed.

In adding link to an issue you can add the link target issue to a text field. The text field is also a search box, which opens a list of issues. In this list the highlight foreground color is black, like it should be.

I see that default highlight background color is blue, which is quite a dark color. But it can be changed. If it is changed to lighter color, you should be able to at least also change the highlight foreground color to black. Why can you only change the highlight background color?

Jira v7.1.10.
fields.summary: Menu Item Highlight Foreground Color should be black by default
Share issue button should provide the ability to configure the fields displayed in the sent email

h3. Summary
JIRA logs same message twice (duplicated) into:
* {{atlassian-jira.log}}
*  {{Console}}: catalina.out at Linux and stdout.log at Windows

Snippet from {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}
{code:borderStyle=solid}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false
{code}

h3. Expected Results 
Log messages are logged only once where it's relevant. 

h3. Actual Results
Log messages are logged twice. There are 2 problems caused by this:
* Double the logging, so system can running out of space.  
* {{Console}} doesn't log rotated by JIRA, so it needs to be done by user. At windows this is not a simple task.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
TBD
fields.summary: JIRA logs same message twice into logs and Console

h3. Problem Definition
While browsing for issues in the Issue Navigator (detailed view) using IE 11, the Scrollbar keeps jumping back up to the top of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Open [JAC|https://jira.atlassian.com] in IE 11.
# Go to Issues > Search for issues.
# Change the view to *Detail view* if not already.
# Drag the Scrollbar of the issue list to the bottom of the page or scroll using the mouse scroller.
(i) Screencast of the problem is available in video [^detailedView.mp4].

h3. Expected Result
User will be able to scroll to the bottom of the issue list

h3. Actual Result
The Scroll bar keeps jumping back up to the top of the list, users are unable to scroll down to see any issues

* Please use other browsers like Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: While browsing for issues in detailed view of Issue Navigator in IE 11, the Scrollbar keeps jumping back up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62615].
  {panel}

Confluence has had the ability to use websudo with a custom authenticator since 3.5, using _password.confirmation.disabled_ flag (see -CONF-20958-).

Why s there no such capability with JIRA?

Doing something similar to _isPasswordConfirmationDisabled()_ in _com.atlassian.jira.security.websudo.InbuiltAuthenticatorCheck_ would bring some commonality between Confluence and JIRA.

Why? I have implemented custom authenticators for JIRA and Confluence - based on [MIDANAuthenticator|https://github.com/MIDAN-SOFTWARE/MIDANAuthenticator] - whilst waiting for a solution to JSD-1244. (Accepting that internal users with a Crowd account get SSO features but external JSD customers don't)

With a custom authenticator I can still have websudo in Confluence; but not with JIRA.
fields.summary: JIRA features that require password confirmation (websudo, captcha) do not work with custom authentication

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Project Import failed with error {{There was a SAX parsing problem accessing the partitioned XML files: Invalid label 'xxxx' specified..}} if any project issue has a label value with space

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Create a test project and a test issue.
# Using a Word Processor such as Microsoft Word, create a bulleted list and type a word after the bullet.
# Copy the word and paste it as on the *Labels* field for a test issue.
#* !label.gif! 
# Generate a backup of the instance.
# Use *Project Import* to import the test project to another instance.

h3. Expected result
The project will be imported successfully.

h3. Actual result
The project import fails with error below on the UI of the Project Import page:
{code}
There was a SAX parsing problem accessing the partitioned XML files: Invalid label '• You' specified..
{code}

Stack trace below can be seen in {{atlassian-jira.log}}.
{code}
2016-11-18 23:58:01,800 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 ERROR admin 1438x823x1 1wtdlxl 10.60.9.243 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.j.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService] There was a problem accessing the partitioned XML files when performing a project import.
org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid label '• You' specified.
com.atlassian.jira.exception.ParseException: Invalid label '• You' specified.
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endTopLevelElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:225)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:136)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.ParseException: Invalid label '• You' specified.
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.parser.LabelParserImpl.parse(LabelParserImpl.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.LabelsPersisterHandler.handleEntity(LabelsPersisterHandler.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endTopLevelElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:221)
	... 29 more
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Unzip the backup file and edit the {{entities.xml}} in a Text Editor.
# Find the line of the problematic value.
#* For example, {{<Label id="10203" issue="11700" label="•	     You"/>}}
# Remove all the space between the bullet and the word and save the file.
#* For example, {{<Label id="10203" issue="11700" label="•You"/>}}
# Zip the edited {{entities.xml}} with {{activeobjects.xml}} again and use this new zipped file for project import.
(i) Thanks to our awesome customer, [~epo973353089] for the workaround!
fields.summary: Project Import failed with error "Invalid label specified" if the project issue contains a label value with space

h3. Problem Definition

When regular users don't have the necessary permissions to create rooms in HipChat and once they try to create a room from JIRA clicking in "Create a room" button, JIRA throws this error:

 !jira_create_room.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Improve message error with "Create a room" button in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62604].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In some cases it might be helpful to have JIRA be able to send out notifications to other linked issues, when the main issue is updated/closed/etc.  Presently this is not possible within JIRA, as all changes to a single issue only follow the given notification scheme which applies to all issues in that project.


For example, if you have a project called "ABC" and there are three issues in the project. In which,

ABC-1 (assignee:John) is linked to ABC-2(assignee: Mary) and
ABC-1 (assignee:John) is also linked to ABC-3 (assignee: Paul).

If ABC-1 issue is updated, John already gets notified as he is the assignee, however it would be nice if there was an option to also notify the assignees of other linked issues such as Mary and Paul.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a notification scheme event such as "Linked issue updated" to be created in turn fire an alert


h3. Workaround 
It might be possible to use a 3rd party plugin like scriptrunner in order to create a script that would check all existing linked issues when an update was made, and in turn create an edit/update on those issues in order to trigger a notification.   However this could be tricky since if you have a large environment with lots of issues linked to other issues, in theory you could create a tsunami of email notifications with a single change to one issue (something that could cause severe performance problems, as well as inbox problems).
fields.summary: Ability for a notification event to fire on linked issues when an update is made from the other issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62602].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Within the Issue Create Screen of JIRA, you currently cannot configure the screen to display a web link field.  While you can select the "Linked Issues" field, this only allows you to link to existing issues in JIRA, and not to remote web sites.

h3. Suggested Solution
I'm not sure if this requires the web links to have a separate field definition from other Issue links within JIRA in order to accomplish, however this would be a nice feature to have for environments that would want to say for example, require a web link exist for an issue to be created.


h3. Workaround 
You could try to create a custom field and place that on the create screen in order to store this URL data.  However this obviously would not be displayed within JIRA as a web link/issue link would display.
fields.summary: Ability to add a web link to an issue create screen in JIRA

fields.description:
h5. Summary
Assignee field is not visible on 'Create Linked Issue' (functionality available for Business/Service Desk projects on JIRA 7 and above) screen even if unassigned issues are disabled on the instance. On the regular 'Create Issue' screen the field is show normally.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to General Configuration and turn off the option 'Allow Unassigned Issues'
# Create a issue on a Business or Service Desk project. Note that the assignee field appears, if it has already been added to the respective create issue screen.
# On the Issue View screen of the newly created issue, select More > Create Linked Issue
# Note that the assignee field does not appear, even though it is theoretically a required field. The linked issue will use the default assignee for the project, however.

h5. Work-around
This is not possible to add the Assignee field to the 'Create Linked Issue' screen. To have issues assigned to users other than the default it is required to manually edit the linked issue and change the assignee.
fields.summary: Assignee field is not visible on 'Create Linked Issue' screen even if unassigned issues are disabled

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Attempting to JQL search for cascading select values results in an error like:
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'testcascadefield' does not exist.

{code}
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 * Have a cascading select field (i.e. testcascadefield) with at least 2 defined contexts. Let's call them ContextA and ContextBC
 ** ContextA is configured for ProjectA
 ** ContextB is configured for 2 projects: ProjectB and ProjectC
 * Now configure the value options of ContextA and ContextB to have overlap
 ** For example, let's say both allows for selecting the value "foobar"
 * Ensure that your account *does not* have "Browse" permissions to ProjectB and ProjectC
 ** This is the key trigger of the bug
 * Now running the JQL:
{code:java}
testcascadefield in cascadeOption("foobar")

{code}

 * We get the error:
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'testcascadefield' does not exist.
{code}

 * Now, if we grant the user account to either "Browse" permissions to either ProjectB or ProjectC, the error does not occur.

So the problem occurs on 2 conditions:
# if there is a context containing no projects that the user account can see
** As long as there's at least 1 project in the context viewable to the user, then the error does not occur.
# if there is a option in the context that is the same value as another context

h4. Expected Behaviour
If an user does not have access to projects defined within a field's context, this should not affect the results for contexts that the user does have proper access to

h4. Actual Behaviour
No issues are returned and the user is instead presented with an error

h4. Workaround
# Avoid using the function. "cascadeOption".  So from the above example, use this instead:
{code}
testcascadefield in ("foobar")
{code}
# Or check each context to ensure that the user has access to at least one of the projects listed
# Or avoid having multiple contexts with the same option values
fields.summary: An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field does not exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62590].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When editing a Date Picker field (Due Date, for example), when Jira default language is set to Danish/Portuguese/Slovencina/Swedish/Russian, the date filled when the user clicks on the calendar icon and picks a day is filled with an invalid format.
h4. Examples

For example, in Portuguese-PTBR it is expected a date like 6/set/16 and the date picker fills as 6/Sep/16, throwing an error for the date format.

In the Danish example, all months selected (Except Maj or May) all appear to be forcing their abbreviations with an additional period '.'
{quote}14/nov/18
 Vælg en dato
 Ugyldigt datoformat. Indtast en dato i formatet "d/MMM/yy".
{quote}

 However entering a value such as '14/nov./18' will work correctly (except for the month of may which is not technically abbreviated with only 3 characters).

The same happens with Russian language, forcing months' abbreviations with an additional period '.' 
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.2 or 7.2.1 with a translation pack (tested with Portuguese-PTBR and Slovenian)
 * Jira 7.12.3 with Danish default language set
 * Jira 8.19.1 with Russian default locale language set

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the system administration panel, switch the General Setting of system language to a language such as Danish, Portuguese, or Slovenia
 # Access a ticket on Jira
 # Click on Edit and modify a Date Picker field value, by choosing a date after clicking on the calendar icon next to the field.
 # Attempt to save the date changes

h3. Expected Results

The date is filled correctly according to the language pack.
h3. Actual Results

Jira returns an error message that the date format is invalid. However the javascript date picker, java input format, and look and feel settings are correctly set.
h3. Notes

This bug ticket was originally indicating that the translation pack might have been the cause of this problem. However upon further investigation it appears that Jira itself is not correctly handling regional differences in regards to month names and their appropriate abbreviation to that region / locale. For Danish this is particularly difficult because the region appears to require that 3 letter month abbreviations end with a period. The Javascript date picker can be configured to adjust to that, but not for the month of May/Maj.
h3. Workaround

For Portuguese, Dutch:
 This is not reproducible when using the d/MM/yy format (9/6/16 for example), so users can do the following to change the format:
 # Go to {{Administration > System > Advanced Settings}}
 # Change the following parameters:
{code:java}
jira.date.picker.java.format = d/MM/yy{code}
{code:java}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format = %e/%m/%y{code}
{code:java}
jira.date.time.picker.java.format = dd/MM/yy h:mm a{code}
{code:java}
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format = %e/%m/%y %l:%M %p{code}
fields.summary: Date picker not working when Jira is using Portuguese, Solvenia, Danish, Swedish, Dutch, Russian, German

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading the instance to 7.2.1, the rest call {{rest/api/2/user/assignable/search?project=<Project Name>&username=<User Name> returns multiple rows for user if the user has been edited. Basically it is storing the historical data in the output as well.
This happens for all users that have their username in uppercase.
It is reproducible on a clean instance.
The behaviour is not reproducible on JIRA 7.1.9.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a clean 7.2.1
# Create a new user with username in uppercase
# Make sure this user has assignable user permissions on a project
# Now run this in the browser : {{<Base Url>/rest/api/2/user/assignable/search?project=<ProjectKey>&username=<Username>}}
# Notice there is one row displayed in output
# Now click edit link next to the user.
# Change the email address (for example)
# Now run this in the browser : {{<Base Url>/rest/api/2/user/assignable/search?project=<ProjectKey>&username=<Username>}}
# Notice that there are 2 rows in output. One with new data and one with original data.
# Basically the history is maintained
# Now try the same steps with a username in all lowercase. The issue is not reproducible
# Now try the same steps with JIRA 7.1.9. The issue is not reproducible



h3. Expected Results
Only one row with updated user information should be displayed in the output

h3. Actual Results
The response is displaying multiple rows (capturing all history) of the user information in the output
fields.summary: REST call for assignable user returns multiple rows if username is in uppercase

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62575].
  {panel}

The problem with Cloning a ticket is the following:

With existing ticket types, if a project administrator chooses to make existing fields or even new fields required within a given ticket type, a user of this ticket workflow can easily circumvent the required fields by cloning existing tickets previous to when those fields were required.

If the user uses the “Edit” button on the ticket, the user is presented with the required fields and does not allow them to update through the “Edit” option unless the required fields are met (this is OK).
 Otherwise the fields that are readily viewable/editable at the default screen (even previous customized fields that had existing data) allow the user to modify the ticket still, without the need to enter required field data (again, NOT using the “Edit” button or “Edit” screen).

Considering this, it seems as if the only “absolute” option available is to disable the clone feature in JIRA which is a global feature and would affect all other projects.

This is a serious problem where if the administered required fields are necessary for a company/work process or even audit purposes.

Please address this, by…
 1) allow designated existing or new required fields to be properly flagged to the user when a user chooses to clone a previous existing ticket
 OR
 2) allow the clone feature controllable per project and not at the global level, so that a project administrator can turn off cloning specific to their project to prevent users from circumventing required fields
 OR
 3) allow the clone feature controllable per issue ticket type, again, specific to a project – to prevent users from circumventing required fields
fields.summary: Users should not be able to Clone Issues when required fields exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62566].
  {panel}

We need a similar function at the issue level as provided in AtlaZon's JIRA VOTE FOR COMMENTS plugin [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/info.renjithv.votecomments.jira-addon-votecomments/server/overview]. Unfortunately, this plugin only enables voters to Like or Dislike a comment within issue and provides a summary tally of Comment Likes/Dislikes. It does not provide a way to see who voted for/against or who abstained vs did not vote at all.  This would provide a simple solution for electronic configuration control board approval (or not) for all JIRA Change Requests submitted to our baseline system.

Related to this requirement is that two of the People fields are not being captured/listed in the current JIRA Issue Activity/History tabs: Votes & Watchers. Only Assignee and Reporter are captured under Activity, etc. Is there a way to add the Votes & Watchers as another tab? That would help on the reporting requirement--sort of.

What we really need is to be able to generate Issue level and Project level queries and reports listing Users/Groups showing if and how each person voted, assuming functionality of voting For (Like), Against (Dislike), Abstain (Meh), or Not Voted (Slacker) is added. However, we can't do this now because the current JIRA VOTES field is boolean (either Voted or Not Voted) which only tells you if someone voted or not. It does not tell you if someone is voting FOR, AGAINST, ABSTAINING, is ignoring you, or just hasn't gotten around to voting yet.

Please add the ability to either customize or add additional values/options to the VOTES field or use the social apps like/dislike features already elsewhere in JIRA Comments and Confluence.

We are using JIRA version 7.2.0.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Like & Dislike Voting and Reporting

h3. Summary

The link issue field only shows and searches "recently viewed" issues, unless you click the "search for issues" link underneath the field. Newly created issues do not appear. 

Though [the search for issues flow is documented|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/linking-issues-776997756.html], it is a confusing user experience for people who have recently created an issue and know of its existence. fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to edit the Component Lead and assign it to specific users whose usernames have been renamed before. Below error message is shown:
{noformat}
The user "username" does not exist.
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a project and some Components. 
# Have a user and rename it (i.e from John to A).
# Edit the component lead for a component and set it to the renamed user.
# Receive a "The user "username" does not exist." message.

h3. Expected Result
Able to assign *A* as the new Component Lead for the selected component.

h3. Actual Result
Receive a "The user "username" does not exist." error message.
!user-doesnot-exist.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Update the component lead using REST API:

{code}curl -D- -u admin_username:admin_password -X PUT --data "{\"leadUserName\": \"<user_name>\"}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" <JIRA_URL>/rest/api/2/component/<component_ID>{code} 
(i) <user_name>, <JIRA_URL>, and <component_ID> are to be replaced accordingly
(i) The command is to be run by a JIRA admin and he must authenticate using his admin_username and admin_password

h3.Tips

In order to quickly get <component_ID> via REST API:
# Access this URL replacing <project_Key> with actual project key:
{code}
<JIRA_URL>/rest/api/2/project/<project_Key>
{code}
# Search for {{component/}} and get the ID of the right component:
{code}/rest/api/2/component/10200","id":"10200","name":"component 1"{code}
(i) In this example the component with name "component 1" has ID 10200
fields.summary: Unable to assign certain user as a Component Lead

h3. Summary
Currently it's no possible to change "_My JIRA Home_" once it's set to be "_Boards_".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click your profile picture at the top right corner
# Within "_My JIRA Home_" section select the "_Boards_" option
# Click your profile picture again and select any other option but "_Boards_"

h3. Expected Results
Your JIRA home changes to the selected option and the page refreshes

h3. Actual Results
The option is selected in the menu but the screen doesn't refresh and when you click the JIRA logo the Boards view is still loaded and you can still see the "_Boards_" option selected when you click your profile picture.
 

h3.Workaround
Click on the option twice. The first click will not load the expected page, but the second click will load eventually.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62542].
  {panel}

One of the default JIRA workflows is to mark an issue as "Resolved" and then after verification to mark it as "Closed". Therefore we need a way to filter for all issues that have been marked as "Resolved" but are not yet marked as "Closed".

In JIRA Cloud when I click on "Issues" it defaults to "Open Issues". That's a reasonable default . But in the "Switch filter" list, there is no filter for "Resolved but not closed". There is a "Done issues" option, but that shows both resolved and closed issues, but for this use case we don't want to see see closed issues. We need to see which issues have been "Resolved" but not "Closed".

I'm aware that I can manually add some filter, and every time we add a project we can add this to some complicated Boolean expression to include that project in the filter. But that's not what I'm asking for.

* I don't want to have a filter that shows such issues across all projects. I want it to be shown only for the current project. Just like the "Done issues" filter.
* I don't want to have to add a new filter to each project. I don't have to add the "Done issues" filter, for example---it's just already there.

So please add a "Resolved but not Closed" filter that is available to each project _by default_. After all, the "resolved->closed" workflow is one of the default JIRA workflows, so there needs to be a filter for it.

See related service desk issue [JST-214454|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-214454].
fields.summary: Need default filter for "resolved but not yet closed".

There are significant changes in many areas under the hood, resulting in improved performance, stability, and total cost of ownership. Please refer to the Apache Tomcat 8.5 Changelog for details.
{quote}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62536].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When a user attempts to download the JIRA core source code, on accessing the page with a valid JIRA Software license, they get the error:

{quote}

There are currently no source downloads available for your license. Please contact us for further details.
{quote}

[Our documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Building+JIRA+from+source] states:

{quote}
If you want to browse through the JIRA Core source code, you can download it from our Core source downloads page. You must have a valid JIRA license and be logged in to my.atlassian.com with your Atlassian Id. You can download the JIRA Software source code (this does not contain the JIRA Core source code) from the Software source downloads page.
{quote}

+Customer's Expectation+

Accessing this page they should be able to download the source code.

+Actual Result+

Without the JIRA  core license, they cannot download the source code.

+My Question+

What is the correct expected behavior? As there is a lot of confusion and the documentation only adds to it as it neither says what license it meant hence leading people to assume it could mean a commercial license.

+What to Do+

# Can we have this stated clearly when customers are buying the license what they would be able to do(including what source code is available to them)?
# Can we update the documentation I linked to reflect exactly what license provides what access.
fields.summary: Clear Definition of What License is Required for Downloading JIRA Source Code

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Supported+Platforms], JIRA 6.4 only supports Java (JDK or JRE) versions 7 and 8, and also Oracle 11g. However, the JDBC driver shipped with JIRA for connecting with Oracle, 11.2.0.2.0, is not supported for use with Java 7 and 8 according to [Oracle JDBC FAQ|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_03].

h3. Expected Behavior
Ship JIRA with an Oracle driver compatible with other supported platforms.

h3. Actual Behavior
JIRA ships with Oracle JDBC Driver version 11.2.0.2.0, which doesn't support Java 7 and 8.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Workaround
Download Oracle JDBC driver version 11.2.0.4.0 (latest, at time of writing) from [this Oracle page|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/apps-tech/jdbc-112010-090769.html] and replace the existing {{ojdbc6-11.2.0.2.0.jar}} file under {{<[JIRA_INSTALL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Installation+Directory]>/lib}}.

(!) JIRA needs to be restarted in order to use the new driver.
fields.summary: JIRA ships with Oracle driver not officially supported with Java 7 and 8

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Webhooks set to trigger on the Issue Created of subtasks will not fire when multiple subtasks are created via a post function.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.6
* [Create on Transition for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.jira.cot/server/overview] plugin.  This provides the needed functionality to create the subtasks.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Spin up JIRA 7.1.6 with the Create on Transition plugin
# Create a new project.
# Edit and publish the workflow for the project so that the Create Subtask post function is used to create a subtask.
# Set up a webhook on the Issue Created event with the JQL {{Project = <your project>}}.  Use [RequestBin|https://requestb.in/] for your webhook URL.
# Create an issue in your project and run it through the transition where you added the Create Subtask post function.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue Created event that is fired when the subtask is created will trigger the webhook.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is not fired.

h3.Workaround
You can use the Trigger a Webhook post-function on the create transition of sub-task issue type specific workflow in your project.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not fire when creating sub-tasks via post function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Invalid HTML code in the field description breaks the Field Configuration page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{JIRA Administration > Issues > Field configurations}}.
# Copy the Default Field Configuration.
# Configure the Copy of Default Field Configuration.
# Edit any field e.g. the Assignee field.
# Update the description with HTML code below. (!) Please note that the code below has missing </script> tag.
{code}
<html>
   <body>
   
      <script language="javascript" type="text/javascript">
         <!--
            document.write("Hello World!")
         //-->

   </body>
</html>
{code}

h3. Expected Result
The description will be displayed exactly like the code.

h3. Actual Result
All content below the Assignee field will be empty, the Edit button is also missing and no way to fix this from the UI
 !screen.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
* Remove the invalid HTML code from the database table {{fieldlayoutitem}}
(!) Always back up data before performing any direct database modification. Better yet, test them out in a non-production instance first.
* Edit the source of the page to make the Edit button appear again so that users can edit the description
(*) Thanks to our awesome customer for [this workaround|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62525?focusedCommentId=956911&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-956911]

h3. Summary

JQL WAS searches should be able to map out a renamed user to the user_key stored in the issue change history. At the moment, you need to type in the old username (user_key) to retrieve results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an issue.
2. Assign it to a user with username (and user_key) fred
3. Assign it to another user (e.g. admin)
4. Rename fred to fred_normal.
5. Perform a JQL search for {{assignee WAS fred_normal}}

h3. Expected Results
The issue created in step 1 is returned in the search results.

h3. Actual Results
The issue created in step 1 is not returned in the search results.

h3. Workaround

Perform the JQL WAS search using the old username (user_key).

In the example from the reproduction scenario above, {{assignee WAS fred}}

h3. Environment
 * PostgreSQL 9.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.0.10 or 7.1.9
 # Install JIRA Service Desk 3.0.10 or 3.1.9
 # Upgrade JIRA to 7.2.0
 # Navigate to *Cog Icon > Applications > Upgrade JIRA Service Desk to 3.2.0*
 # Navigate to any other page in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should be accessible after the upgrade.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA becomes inacessible, showing a 500 error with the following stack trace:
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-29 at 1.26.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
{code:java}
Technical details
Log's referral number: 1949e8c6-a651-4a17-8ab8-d8f1b3666a10
Cause

	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forward(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:55) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forwardSafely(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:83) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.SanitizingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(SanitizingServletForwarder.java:48) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.RememberingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(RememberingServletForwarder.java:75) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.ResolvingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(ResolvingServletForwarder.java:52) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingResponse.lambda$null$0(RedirectInterceptingResponse.java:43) [?:?]
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215) [?:1.8.0_77]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingResponse.lambda$sendRedirect$1(RedirectInterceptingResponse.java:43) [?:?]
	at java.util.Optional.flatMap(Optional.java:241) [?:1.8.0_77]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingResponse.sendRedirect(RedirectInterceptingResponse.java:43) [?:?]

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having a comma in a text field will put values in wrong fields on a CSV exported from JIRA
h3. Environment

JIRA server 7.1.x
 JIRA server 7.2.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue
 # Put a comma in any place among the text in the Description field or any other text field
 # From the issue navigator, export the issue to a CSV file (e.g. Export > CSV (All fields))

h3. Expected Results

The CSV file will be created with the correct values for every field
h3. Actual Results

Values after the comma will be exported to the wrong field in the CSV file, putting every field values after that in the wrong column in the CSV file
h3. Workaround

Certain Microsoft Excel configurations does not correctly handle JIRA CSV export format. This typically depends on the region where product is installed.

To workaround the problem, one can use the Export to HTML feature that is available in JIRA 7.4.0 and latter.

 

Step 1. Export the data to HTML from JIRA

!workaround-html-export.png|thumbnail!

 

Step 2. Import the file into Excel.

Following options are available:
 * Import Menu available in Microsoft Excel, chose the .html file exported from JIRA.
 * Rename the exported file to .xls extension so it can be opened as ab Excel spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Comma in a text field breaks CSV export

Colour would be associated to the estimate the team is provides for the issue.

Whichever option the board is configured too, example Story points, any issues with a estimate of 1 would be green, 2 blue, 3 orange.

This way, as the team reviews the Control chart, they can also review issues based on story points estimated. Similar estimates would create a cluster easily identified by the colour. If a colour appears outside of the cluster, then the team can review the and action how to improve estimation for the next sprint.

Just a suggest that would make the control chart awesome.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62515].
  {panel}

The example [JIRA REST API Example Cookie based Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+Cookie-based+Authentication] page is incomplete, or at least the information in  there is not sufficient for Cloud customers:

According to above page it should be enough to get the value for JSESSIONID sending a request to jira/rest/auth/1/session and set it in the header of the successive requests in order to have it working.

However, this is not true/not enough (at least in Cloud). Also other Cookies are returned in the header of the response containing the JSESSIONID value and in order to successfully use Cookie authentication you must provide all those Cookies in the successive requests.



*Example:* (from: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-218465 )

In the first response I got back:
{noformat}
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BBFK-DW9I-1O0T-XAI2|d1f29197aefac82758df8ba7af6718590a4af86e|lout; Path=/; Secure

Set-Cookie: studio.crowd.tokenkey=""; Domain=.zaansmeisje.atlassian.net; Expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:10 GMT; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
Set-Cookie: studio.crowd.tokenkey=k4G0k02877DJJRTeBG6EUQ00; Domain=.zaansmeisje.atlassian.net; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly 
{noformat}


Therefore in my successive request I set the same Cookies in the header then it works. If I only set the JSESSIONID value it fails returning "401 Unauthorized":
{noformat}
-H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BBFK-DW9I-1O0T-XAI2|d1f29197aefac82758df8ba7af6718590a4af86e|lout; JSESSIONID=39EB1259A8CA92F7E62B8F4348AE9884; studio.crowd.tokenkey=k4G0k02877DJJRTeBG6EUQ00;" 
{noformat}


*Full request and response:*

{"expand":"schema,names","startAt":0,"maxResults":10,"total":4,"issues":[{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"11304","self":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/11304","key":"BUS-4","fields":{"issuetype":{"self":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issuetype/10200","id":"10200","description":"A task that needs to be done.","iconUrl":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=10318&avatarType=issuetype","name":"Task","subtask":false,"avatarId":10318},"timespent":null,"project":{"self":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/project/10900","id":"10900","key":"BUS","name":"bussines","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/secure/projectavatar?avatarId=10324","24x24":"https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/secure/projectavatar?":........
{noformat}


h3. Workaround

When calling the session endpoint just store all the cookie information in a file and use that to authenticate. E.g.:
# Store the cookie in a cookie jar: {noformat}
curl -c cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"XXXXXXXXX", "password":"XXXXXXXXX" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE/rest/auth/1/session

OR

curl --cookie-jar cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"XXXXXXXXX", "password":"XXXXXXXXX" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE/rest/auth/1/session 
{noformat}
# Use that to authenticate the successive REST calls: {noformat}
curl -b cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET https://INSTANCE/rest/........

OR

curl --cookie cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET https://INSTANCE/rest/........ 
{noformat}
fields.summary: The documentation for REST API Cookie authentication is incomplete (for Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to see "configure" option Application Navigator while hovering mouse over the "configure" option.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2.0 and 7.2.1

h3. Expected Results

The "configure" option shown correctly when the option is highlighted. 

 !Screenshot from 2016-09-13 16-40-35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The "configure" word is hidden.

 !Screenshot from 2016-09-13 16-39-16.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

None. Users can still click on the "Configure" option.
fields.summary: Unable to see "configure" option Application Navigator

h3. Summary
JIRA is inaccessible and you get _This site can’t be reached_ error. Almost all incoming http threads except one are blocked waiting for cache {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} to be populated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Initiate large number of call loading data from {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} cache, eg: URL: _/secure/BrowseProject.jspa_
# Check that JIRA is not accessible after some time.

h3. Notes
h4. Verification
Taking thread dumps as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] during problematic periods of slowness, and searching for the below stack traces can indicate this is a problem:

{code:borderStyle=solid}
grep -c 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt 
150

grep 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep -c 'waiting on condition' 
145

grep -A 20 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep -c 'getProjectContextIdsForQuery' 
145

grep 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep runnable 
"http-bio-80-exec-37" #255 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x000000002b37d000 nid=0x1c48 runnable
{code}

h5. Other notes
This actual bug is not caused by large number of version, but happy assumption in cache loader {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} that it will take feasible amount of time
to resolve queries
Problem with large number of versions is mitigated in [JRA-62666|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62666] bug and fixed in JIRA 7.1.2 and 6.4.14

h5. Related bugs
* loading cache {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} is exectuted as part of {{findRapidViewsByProject}} method, see JSWSERVER-16130
* loading cache  {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} is done as part of {{board-scope-filter}}  loading data for sidebar, see JSWSERVER-16185 
* combination of those 2 bugs makes any thread which needs sidebar to render the page to also wait for this cache. 

h3.Workaround 
Applicable for JIRA 6.4.x only, From JRA-45178 
Use the following steps below. 
# Disable the {{board-scope-filter}} module in JIRA Agile Add-on ({{board-scope-filter}} module tells the sidebar the list of boards to show on the board dropdown as well as the board that is currently selected.). This will disable {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext}} method. 
## Navigate through Administration menu > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons > Select 'JIRA Agile'
## Expand the JIRA Agile Add-on modules
## Find the 'board-scope-filter' module and disable it.
# Disable Project Navigation (Sidebar project navigation) for all users: Administration Menu > System > Project Navigation
fields.summary: all JIRA threads is blocked waiting for cache getProjectContextIdsForQuery
